main.name: Alec McGlone
main.description: Currently contributing to open source projects trying to help make the community a better place. I enojoy building mini projects from scratch and larger apps for clients
main.bio: I am a science fiction enjoyer, with a love for running, an interest in a technological singularity, and a devotion to learn the many intricacies of coding. Born in a small town in Southwestern CT, I made my move for the love of beaches and ability to leave the cold behind. I like to build things, preferably without breaking them, until they can be in their best form. Outside of projects I picked up the textbooks K.N. King's "C Programming | A Modern Approach" and "Computer Systems: A Programmers Perspective" in the hopes of one day building a new operating system. In my freetime I enjoy reading, playing minecraft, and listening to Lex Fridman's Various conversations about the future of our species.
main.contactmessage: Have a project for me? Think I'd be a good fit for your team? I'd love to hear from you, give me a shout by email, linkedIn or github if you'd like to get in contact with me.

resume.skillmessage: Some of the skills I have learned so far and look forward to adding more

education.description: I thrived in an accelerated 6 month curriculum which covered everything from HTML, CSS, and Javascript to MySQL, MongoDb, Express.js, ReactJs, and NodeJs. I put my skills to the test and built a variety of user driven applications. I also learned the importance of not creating merge conflicts and how to fix them should they arise.

work.title: Full Stack Developer
work.description: My client needed a webapp to display messages from a discord "| news" channel and a staff login route to send messages back to the channel for select staff members. I learned how to create a bot with discord.js, fetch old channel messages, send new messages, and fetch a list of all members in the server to handle @mentions all while integrated with a mysql database.

testimonials.text: To succeed, planning along is insufficient. One must improvise as well.
When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.
I'd Rather be partly great than entirely useless.
